e_score.text: When you attend a social event, you usually:

options.text: Enjoy engaging with new people and feel energized
Prefer having deeper conversations with a few close friends

e_score.text: After a long day, you prefer to:

options.text: Relax with friends or family, sharing your day's experiences
Spend time alone, reflecting on the day and recharging

e_score.text: You are more likely to be described as:

options.text: Outgoing and sociable
Reserved and reflective

e_score.text: In a group discussion, you tend to:

options.text: Share your thoughts openly and actively participate
Listen carefully and share your thoughts when asked

e_score.text: When working on a project, you prefer to:

options.text: Collaborate with others and exchange ideas
Work independently and gather your thoughts before sharing
Make new friends and establish connections
Maintain a close circle of long-term friendships

e_score.text: When learning something new, you prefer to:

options.text: Discuss it with others and hear their perspectives
Reflect on it by yourself and form your own understanding
Consult others and seek their opinions
Spend time alone, contemplating the options

e_score.text: In a team setting, you are more likely to:

options.text: Take the lead and communicate with others frequently
Focus on your tasks and contribute without drawing attention

e_score.text: When brainstorming ideas, you prefer to:

options.text: Discuss your ideas with others to get their input
Think through your ideas independently before sharing

s_score.text: When solving a problem, you rely more on:

options.text: Concrete facts and tangible data
Intuition and abstract concepts

s_score.text: You tend to be more interested in:

options.text: Practical applications of ideas
Theoretical possibilities and underlying patterns

s_score.text: When making decisions, you prefer to:

options.text: Focus on real-world considerations and consequences
Consider future potential and broader implications

s_score.text: You are more likely to trust:

options.text: Direct experience and proven facts
Gut feelings and hunches

s_score.text: In a conversation, you tend to focus on:

options.text: Specific details and practical matters
Concepts, ideas, and underlying themes

s_score.text: When planning a project, you prefer to:

options.text: Outline specific steps and milestones
Envision the big picture and adapt as needed
Hands-on activities and practical experiences
Abstract thinking and intellectual exploration

s_score.text: When evaluating a situation, you prioritize:

options.text: The current reality and what can be observed
The potential for future development and change

s_score.text: In a learning environment, you prefer:

options.text: Hands-on experiences and real-world examples
Exploring theories and concepts that explain the world

s_score.text: Your communication style is more focused on:

options.text: Concrete information and specific examples
Ideas, connections, and broader implications
Objective logic and analysis
Personal values and emotions

t_score.text: You are more likely to be described as:

options.text: Rational and objective
Sensitive and empathetic

t_score.text: When giving feedback to others, you tend to:

options.text: Focus on identifying flaws and areas for improvement
Consider the person's feelings and offer encouragement

t_score.text: You prefer to resolve conflicts by:

options.text: Analyzing the situation and finding a logical solution
Addressing people's feelings and finding common ground

t_score.text: In a group setting, you tend to:

options.text: Focus on the task at hand and achieving the goal
Pay attention to the group dynamics and people's emotions

t_score.text: When facing a tough decision, you rely more on:

options.text: Critical thinking and weighing pros and cons
Your gut feeling and personal values

t_score.text: You are more likely to be influenced by:

options.text: Data, evidence, and logical arguments
Personal connections and emotional appeals

t_score.text: When working on a project, you prefer to:

options.text: Set clear objectives and evaluate progress based on results
Consider the well-being of team members and foster a positive atmosphere

t_score.text: You believe that rules and regulations:

options.text: Should be followed strictly for the sake of efficiency
Can be flexible depending on the needs of the people involved

t_score.text: When evaluating someone's performance, you place more emphasis on:

options.text: Achievement of goals and adherence to standards
The person's growth and personal development

j_score.text: When it comes to planning, you prefer to:

options.text: Have a detailed plan and schedule
Keep things open-ended and flexible

j_score.text: You are more likely to be described as:

options.text: Organized and structured
Spontaneous and adaptable

j_score.text: When working on a project, you prefer to:

options.text: Set deadlines and stick to them
Work at your own pace and adjust as needed
Making decisions and moving forward
Keeping your options open and gathering more information

j_score.text: When attending an event, you prefer to:

options.text: Arrive on time or early
Arrive whenever it feels right, even if it's a bit late

j_score.text: In your personal life, you are more likely to:

options.text: Stick to routines and established habits
Be spontaneous and go with the flow

j_score.text: When faced with a decision, you usually:

options.text: Analyze the options and make a choice quickly
Take your time to explore all possibilities before deciding

j_score.text: Your approach to completing tasks is:

options.text: Focused on finishing one task before starting another
Flexible and open to switching between tasks as needed
Should be clearly defined and pursued systematically
Can change and evolve as new information becomes available

j_score.text: When it comes to time management, you tend to:

options.text: Plan your day and allocate time for tasks
Take things as they come and adapt to the situation
